WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: There is an insect sliding around under your table from the wind. You try to grab the insect but it keeps sliding past your hand because the wind is so strong. It‚Äôs going to start blowing you around under the table too!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info:
Picture an insect, on its back, being blown around under a table. Feel the wind pushing you as you try to save the poor thing.
This kanji also means style too. You can think of the wind blowing one style in fashion one moment and then another the next. It blows your clothes off and blows new style clothes onto you, over and over again. Imagine this happening. Are you embarrassed when all the clothes are off? Pleased when you get new style clothes on?
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The only way you can distract yourself from the wind and the insect sliding around under your table is by eating lots of food („Åµ„ÅÜ). That‚Äôs why you were at the table in the first place. It‚Äôs your dining room table and it‚Äôs dinner time!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Try to stuff food in your mouth in the wind. Food tastes even better when you have to fight for it!

origin_of_ch_char_book: Stag beetles with bow-like horn (È¢®, È£é, feng, wind) means a house or a shelter from the sun, and is a stinging worm. In the winter, a cold wind blows in through the cracks of the house, just like a venomous worm‚Äôs sting; therefore, this character became to mean a ‚Äòwind‚Äô. Because the wind comes from the outside, it also refers to the customs and scenery of other regions and places.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " worm ", " where " sound, the original meaning is the phenomenon of air flow. "Said Wen": "Eight winds. The east is called Ming Shufeng, the southeast is called Qingming breeze, the south is called Jingfeng, the southwest is called cool breeze, the west is called Changfeng, the northwest is called irregular breeze, the north is called Guangmofeng, and the northeast is called Melting the wind. The wind moves the insects, so the insects will be transformed in eight days. From the insects, all sounds. All the wind belongs to the wind." "Poetry‚ÄßZhengfeng‚ÄßXixi": "The wind blows the girl. ."

" Wind " can mean enlightenment. "Shu ‚Äß Shuo Mingxia": "Salary admiration of my virtue, time is wind." Kong Chuan: "Wind, teach."

" Wind " also means customs and ethos. "Twenty-one Years of Zuo Zhuan‚Äß Zhaogong": "The emperor saves the wind for fun." Du pre-notes: "Saves the customs and plays for the fun."

" Wind " also means grace and integrity. "Mencius-Ten Thousand Chapters": "Those who hear the style of Bo Yi are stubborn and honest, and cowards are determined."

" Wind " also refers to the characteristics of a certain technique, work or thought, that is, the style and genre. "Northern History-Li Biyu, Wenxin and Other Biography": "The style of Xin Wuyi is famous for the high generation."

" Wind " can also express trends and situations. Tang Niusu's "Ji Wen‚Äß Li Xu": "The world's unbelievers watch the wind destroy and demolish them. Although the big house is like a big image, it is destroyed."

" Wind " also refers to news. Song Su Shunqin "Book by Ye Daoqing, the Envoy of the Ministry of Science and Technology": "When the enemy is in a different country, I am afraid of the wind, and I hate to kill the unseen danger."

" Wind " can also refer to local music, folk songs, and later to poetry. "Zuo Zhuan-Nine Years of Chenggong": "Speaking of predecessors, do not remember the original; playing with the local style, do not forget the old." Yang Bojun's note: "The local style, the local music."

The oracle bone inscriptions use the word " feng " to mean " wind ", add the mark of " fan ", and refer to " feng ".

From the " worm", " where" sound, the original meaning is the phenomenon of air flow. "Said Wen": "Eight winds. The east is called Ming Shufeng, the southeast is called Qingming breeze, the south is called Jingfeng, the southwest is called cool breeze, the west is called Changfeng, the northwest is called irregular breeze, the north is called Guangmofeng, and the northeast is called Melting the wind. The wind moves the insects, so the insects will be transformed in eight days. From the insects, all sounds. All the wind belongs to the wind." "Poetry‚ÄßZhengfeng‚ÄßXixi": "The wind blows the girl. ." " Wind" can mean enlightenment. "Shu ‚Äß Shuo Mingxia": "Salary admiration of my virtue, time is wind." Kong Chuan: "Wind, teach." " Wind" also means customs and ethos. "Twenty-one Years of Zuo Zhuan‚Äß Zhaogong": "The emperor saves the wind for fun." Du pre-notes: "Saves the customs and plays for the fun." " Wind" also means grace and integrity. "Mencius-Ten Thousand Chapters": "Those who hear the style of Bo Yi are stubborn and honest, and cowards are determined." " Wind" also refers to the characteristics of a certain technique, work or thought, that is, the style and genre. "Northern History-Li Biyu, Wenxin and Other Biography": "The style of Xin Wuyi is famous for the high generation." " Wind" can also express trends and situations. Tang Niusu's "Ji Wen‚Äß Li Xu": "The world's unbelievers watch the wind destroy and demolish them. Although the big house is like a big image, it is destroyed." " Wind" also refers to news. Song Su Shunqin "Book by Ye Daoqing, the Envoy of the Ministry of Science and Technology": "When the enemy is in a different country, I am afraid of the wind, and I hate to kill the unseen danger." " Wind" can also refer to local music, folk songs, and later to poetry. "Zuo Zhuan-Nine Years of Chenggong": "Speaking of predecessors, do not remember the original; playing with the local style, do not forget the old." Yang Bojun's note: "The local style, the local music." The oracle bone inscriptions use the word " feng" to mean " wind", add the mark of " fan", and refer to " feng".
